result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:55 AM Defendant Dillon J. Hall in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Dillon J. Hall.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   State indicates has reviewed the motion to suppress.  Attny Chapman makes statement.   State  offers  Exhibits 1 and 2, Attny Chapman no objection.  State provides copies to Court.  

11:08 AM  State calls witness, City of Hayward Officer, Ryan Krummel,  Court sworn in.  State begins examination.  11:13 AM Witness identified the DEF,  Attny Chapman no objection. Court indicates the record will reflect.   State continues examination.  11:17 AM  Attny Chapman Objection, vague.  Court sustained.    Witness, request to review report.  State continues examination.     State shows witness Exhibit 2,  Warning Violation.  State continues examination.     State shows witness Exhibit 1.     State offers Exhibit 1 and 2.   Attny Chapman objects to authentication to Exhibit 1.  Exhibit 2 is admitted.     11:33 AM  Cross examination by Attny Chapman.    11:35 PM  OFF THE RECORD:  Attny Chapman connect to video.   11:38 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD;  Atty Chapman has video connected.  Attny Chapman plays video.    Attny Chapman cross examination continues.    No further questions for this witness by either party. 11:52 AM  Witness, Officer, Ryan Krummel excused.

11:52 AM  State calls witness, City of Hayward Officer,  Dillon Saraniecki, Court sworn in.  State begins examination.   State provides Exhibit 1, Call Detail Log,  Witness describes CAD sheet.  State continues examination.    12:10 PM Cross examination by Attny Chapman.    12:11 PM  State re-direct.   12:13 PM  Attny Chapman re-cross.   Discussion over each other, court makes statement.  Attny Chapman continues re-cross.   No further questions by either party.  12:15 PM  Witness, Officer, Dillon Saraniecki, excused.   State offer Exhibit 1,  Exhibit 1 is received.  

12:15 PM  State calls witness, Deputy Dennis Nelson, sworn by court.  State begins examination.  State shows witness Exhibit 1.  Examination continues.  State shows witness Exhibit 2.  12:25 PM  Attny Chapman objects, foundation.  State makes foundation.  12:27 PM  Attny Chapman objection, as to foundation of software.  Discussion/Argument takes place.  State no further questions.   12:28 PM  Attny Chapman objection questioning of Officer stop.  Discussion follows.     Attny Chapman withdraw objection.      12:32 PM  Cross examination by Attny Chapman.   12:33 PM   Attny Chapman plays rest of video.    No further questions by either party.  12:35 PM  Witness, Deputy Dennis Nelson excused

Attny Chapman requests to hold open, in order to request information from TRACS system.   12:36 PM  OFF THE RECORD: Discussion between ADA and Officers  12:36 PM  BACK ON THE RECORD:    Discussion takes place.   Court to hold open.      Attny Chapman offers Exhibit 3 - Flash Drive,  Exhibit 3 - Admitted
